00040 #ifndef _datatypes_h
00041 #define _datatypes_h
00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 //Any Special data types that we need will get declared right here
00044 ///////////////////////////////////////
00045 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00046 
00047 #include <string>
00048 #include <sstream>
00049 #include <vector>
00050 
00051 /// @internal
00052 /// @brief Forward declaration for SDL compatibilty
00053 union SDL_Event;
00054 
00055 namespace phys
00056 {
00057     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00058     // Datatypes
00059     ///////////////////////////////////////
00060 
00061     /// @internal
00062     /// @brief Forward declaration for use with soundset
00063     class Sound;
00064 
00065     /// @typedef Real
00066     /// @brief A Datatype used to represent a real floating point number
00067     /// @details This Datatype is currently a typedef to a float, This is to match
00068     /// our compilations of Ogre (rendering subsystem ogre::Real), and Bullet (physics
00069     /// subsystem, btScalar). With a recompilation of all the subsystems and  this
00070     /// there is no theoretical reason why this could not be changed to a
00071     /// double, or even something more extreme like a GMP datatype. Most likely this
00072     /// switch would require atleast some troubleshooting.
00073     typedef float Real;
00074 
00075     /// @typedef Whole
00076     /// @brief A Datatype used to represent an postive integer numbers
00077     /// @details This is a typedef to unsigned Long. but could be smaller in some situations
00078     typedef unsigned long Whole;
00079 
00080     /// @typedef Integer
00081     /// @brief A datatype use to represent any integer close to
00082     /// @details This is a typedef to int, but could int16 or smaller to improve performance in some situtations
00083     /// handheld platforms
00084     typedef int Integer;
00085 
00086     /// @typedef String
00087     /// @brief A Datatype used to a series of characters
00088     /// @details This is a typedef to std::string, but could change particularly if UTF16 or UTF32 support is desired. If this is
00089     /// changed, The Character typedef should be adjusted accordingly.
00090     typedef std::string String;
00091 
00092     /// @typedef ConstString
00093     /// @brief A Datatype used to a series of imutable characters
00094     /// @details This is a typedef to const String, but could change.
00095     typedef const String ConstString;
00096 
00097     /// @typedef Character
00098     /// @brief A datatype to represent one character.
00099     /// @details This should be a char if String is an std::string. The XML parser expects this to be either char or wchar_t
00100     /// and has not be test with external types. The XML Parser expects XML_WCHAR_MODE to be defined if wchar_t is used. A remarked
00101     /// definition of this exists near the Character typedef in datatypes.h
00102     typedef char Character;
00103     // #define XML_WCHAR_MODE   //UNREMARK ME if changing the above line to typedef wchar_t Character;
00104 
00105 
00106     /// @internal
00107     /// @typedef RawEvent
00108     /// @brief This is an internal datatype use to communicate with the User input Subsystem
00109     /// @details This is a typedef to SDL_Event. See the SDL Documentation for more details
00110     typedef SDL_Event RawEvent;
00111 
00112     /// @typedef SoundSet
00113     /// @brief This is a vector that stores sounds.
00114     /// @details This is a vector and can be use to store sounds that can be grouped together
00115     /// for similiar purposes or similiar content for easy tracking.
00116     typedef std::vector< Sound* > SoundSet;
00117 
00118     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00119     // Simple conversion functions
00120     ///////////////////////////////////////
00121 
00122     /// @brief Converts whatever to a String as long as a streaming operator is available for it
00123     /// @param Datum The whatever to be converted
00124     /// @return A String with the converted data
00125     template<class T> String ToString( const T& Datum )
00126     {
00127         static std::stringstream Converter;
00128         Converter.str("");
00129         Converter << Datum;
00130         return Converter.str();
00131     }
00132 
00133     /// @brief Converts whatever to a Whole as long as the proper streaming operators are available for it
00134     /// @param Datum The whatever to be converted
00135     /// @return A Whole with the converted data
00136     template<class T> Whole ToWhole( const T& Datum )
00137     {
00138         static std::stringstream Converter;
00139         Converter.str("");
00140         Converter << Datum;
00141         Whole Results;
00142         Converter >> Results;
00143         return Results;
00144     }
00145 
00146     /// @brief Converts whatever to an Integer as long as the proper streaming operators are available for it
00147     /// @param Datum The whatever to be converted
00148     /// @return An Integer with the converted data
00149     template<class T> Integer ToInteger( const T& Datum )
00150     {
00151         static std::stringstream Converter;
00152         Converter.str("");
00153         Converter << Datum;
00154         Integer Results;
00155         Converter >> Results;
00156         return Results;
00157     }
00158 
00159     /// @brief Converts whatever to an int as long as the proper streaming operators are available for it
00160     /// @param Datum The whatever to be converted
00161     /// @return An int with the converted data
00162     /// @details This exists for interacting with other libraies, in situations where changing the Integer Typedef could
00163     /// break things
00164     template<class T> int Toint( const T& Datum )
00165     {
00166         static std::stringstream Converter;
00167         Converter.str("");
00168         Converter << Datum;
00169         int Results;
00170         Converter >> Results;
00171         return Results;
00172     }
00173 
00174     /// @brief Converts whatever to an unsigned int as long as the proper streaming operators are available for it
00175     /// @param Datum The whatever to be converted
00176     /// @return An unsigned int with the converted data
00177     /// @details This exists for interacting with other libraies, in situations where changing the Integer Typedef could
00178     /// break things
00179     template<class T> unsigned int Tounsignedint( const T& Datum )
00180     {
00181         static std::stringstream Converter;
00182         Converter.str("");
00183         Converter << Datum;
00184         unsigned int Results;
00185         Converter >> Results;
00186         return Results;
00187     }
00188 
00189     /// @brief Converts whatever to an Real as long as the proper streaming operators are available for it
00190     /// @param Datum The whatever to be converted
00191     /// @return An Real with the converted data
00192     template<class T> int ToReal( const T& Datum )
00193     {
00194         static std::stringstream Converter;
00195         Converter.str("");
00196         Converter << Datum;
00197         Real Results;
00198         Converter >> Results;
00199         return Results;
00200     }
00201 
00202     /// @brief Converts whatever to a float as long as the proper streaming operators are available for it
00203     /// @param Datum The whatever to be converted
00204     /// @return An float with the converted data
00205     /// @details This exists for interacting with other libraies, in situations where changing the Real Typedef could
00206     /// break things
00207     template<class T> int Tofloat( const T& Datum )
00208     {
00209         static std::stringstream Converter;
00210         Converter.str("");
00211         Converter << Datum;
00212         float Results;
00213         Converter >> Results;
00214         return Results;
00215     }
00216 
00217     /// @brief Converts whatever to a double as long as the proper streaming operators are available for it
00218     /// @param Datum The whatever to be converted
00219     /// @return An bouble with the converted data
00220     /// @details This exists for interacting with other libraies, in situations where changing the Typedefs could break things
00221     template<class T> int Todouble( const T& Datum )
00222     {
00223         static std::stringstream Converter;
00224         Converter.str("");
00225         Converter << Datum;
00226         double Results;
00227         Converter >> Results;
00228         return Results;
00229     }
